website_summaries.verdict: Inexpensive option that can be used in nearly any type of pool. It's non-electric and works in tandem with your existing filtration system.
pros: This effective cleaner is budget friendly and can clean both the bottom and walls of a pool
cons: Not as durable as more expensive models
It also tends to get stuck in corners and doesn't always clean all the way up pool walls

customer_reviews.title: Works great with attached leaf canister
customer_reviews.text: I'm more than impressed! Finally a clean pool. For those of you that deal with leaves and tree debris , I've attached a leaf canister to the vacuum without a problem. That way, only the fine stuff goes in my filter, as I am using my skimmer line and don't want to clog it. In case you need to add a leaf canister, here's the product link:  The two work together very efficiently. If your vaccuum gets stuck by the stairs, try moving the weight rings. I think I found the perfect place for them after trying a few times. All in all a great pool vac for the price. I should have bought this a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: Elly D.

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second, and we'll continue to buy these. After about a year and a half, it looks like things were wearing out. I suppose we could've replaced or tweaked a few parts, but we decided to just buy another. We went through the brand-name stage, and the brand names are really expensive ($300 range), and cost as much to repair as to replace. This unit stays in the pool year round (we're in AZ), works 12 hours per day, and never needs maintenance (it probably does, but we don't do it). We leave it in with 1-2 weekly shocks, algaecide, etc--we never remove it. I do recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Son

customer_reviews.title: Total waste of plastic and money!
customer_reviews.text: Xtremepower, more like basicjunk. Got the pool cleaner/vacuum on Saturday, snapped the plastic together in minutes and in it went. I have a 1-1/2hp pump and a 12x24 inground pool with a 4' to 6' slope/grade. It went around the pool Sat. & Sun. So I assumed it was doing its job and left for the week (M-F) thinking it would be great, nice clean pool when I get back home, but I was wrong. This is garbage! Looks like it ran the same pattern all week, 100+ degrees in FL this past week and 100- stars for this junk.
customer_reviews.author: mufinmaan

customer_reviews.title: Used for a few months and then it stopped performing as intended.
customer_reviews.text: It works at first and then it went belly up too soon. After a few months, the head would not level out to work properly despite the countless hours I spent trying to get it right with the ring weights-I tried every configuration again and again. It should not be that difficult and troublesome. It eventually went to the side of the curb for trash pickup. Even for $88 I expected a better product.
customer_reviews.author: Texas KnowHow

customer_reviews.title: Works great and can climb the wall all the way
customer_reviews.text: This goes pretty fast and can climb up the wall all the way to water level top. The hose would pull it down from the wall once it reaches the top. So no running round the wall but would do up and down. I think this can clean much better than the wheels. Updated: The caveat is that it reduce the water flow greatly and put a stress on the filtering/pumping system. So I would use this if I know I need to clean the surface. Otherwise, the 4-wheel crawler would give me better water flow throughput ...
customer_reviews.author: L. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product especially for the money
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product especially for the money ! Had a more expensive model prior to this one and had nothing but problems ! Cleaned my pool in a matter of a couple of hours! You could see it move across the bottom and walls big difference from my last one ! Had no problems attaching it to my pool ! Very happy with this product the only thing I can say that might be a negative is the occasional rat tat tat you can hear but it is not annoying to me! It does a real good job!
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn perkins

customer_reviews.title: It works, but needs supervision.
customer_reviews.text: Using in AGP w/liner... this vacuum works ok in the sense that it dose move around and it dose bring up stuff... with that said, it needs supervision... it will find the ladder and get hung up, simple to reroute. It tends to stay near the walls then venture in the center, but readjustment of the hose loops once in a while will help. My pool is 33’ long and it won’t quite reach the far side without additional hoses. I normally run it for about 3 hours, checking on it every 20mins or so to readjust when needed. It’ll get 70-80% picked up. I’ll then switch to the pole vacuum and finish the rest plus hard to reach spots.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Works as well as more expensive cleaner
customer_reviews.text: Was not satisfied with the performance of another suction pool cleaner, or the price of its parts to make it better. This pool cleaner cost me 1/3 of the one used prior, which was not doing well after 2 years use. This pool cleaner required some experimenting with adding hoses, but covers all of the pool very well. I would make some comments on the instructions received with it. The instructions are very rudimentary in terms of improving performance. The wights which come with the cleaner to put on the hose do not do anything to the angle or position of the cleaner. From other comments, this one might only last a year, but I'm betting it does last longer.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bowers

customer_reviews.title: Did not perform as advertised.  EPIC FAIL!
customer_reviews.text: This pool cleaner just does not work as advertised. It will go a long for a few feet and then just hover in the same spot. It was a total failure for us. It looks well made, and the instructions are straightforward. I bought it, because I had a back injury and I can not use my manual pool vacuum. It seemed like it was the answer to my problems. Unfortunately, it just did nit perform as advertised. I also had no luck reaching out yo the company for assistance.
customer_reviews.author: velvet serpent

customer_reviews.title: Effective, worth the investment.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered and it arrived within the week; much earlier than anticipated. Our pool is next to a large pine tree that is constantly losing these little balls and it drives us crazy. I bought this and have had it running two consecutive days and it's made a huge difference. I walked out to the pool this morning and did not see one of those little balls. It's very effective and our pool looks impeccable. I highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: johnny figueroa

customer_reviews.title: Works as effectively as a $300 Creepy Crawly Vacuum, with a quarter of the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought a $300 Creepy Crawly Pool Vacuum about 10 years ago, it's been working well but recently the plastic body started to crack. I bought this product with about 25% of the cost and equivalent performance. I didn't write a review right away because I wanted to see if the product is durable, but 4 months later it's still working well. Sometimes the sucking head may be stuck by large leaves or long branches and requires manual clean up, but other than that there has been no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Los Angeles User

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money
customer_reviews.text: I cannot stress this enough: make sure before you review this product, that your filter is in good shape. For those in the know, goes without saying, but for those that don't know it is imperative. No good filter function, no power to suck. This product is simple to put together, easy to install. If once installed you don't see it moving quickly around the floor of the pool and making a "tat tat tat" sound, you most likely installed it incorrectly or your pool filter needs changing. Having said that, it does a good to great job picking up floor debris and, considering the alternatives, you can't beat this price point. I recommend without reservations.
customer_reviews.author: Fos

customer_reviews.title: This thing works!
customer_reviews.text: Love this vacuum. Directions for assembly & use are lacking. The #1 thing to note about using this vacuum is that you HAVE TO make sure to get all air out of the line, before connecting the hose to the vacuum. I learned how to do this best by watching YouTube videos. I just hold one end of the hose up to the return line and then make sure I keep the hose underwater while connecting it to the suction line, so it doesn't fill back up with air. I learned this the hard way! You'll get no suction if you don't do this! Vacuum will make a ticking noise when it's working. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa A Driscoll

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: I’m new to the pool club. We have owned the pool for two month now. We bought a Dolphin Nautilus for near $700 bucks. It’s good with picking up leaves and solid stuff from the pool floor but it doesn’t sucked the thin dust sitting on the bottom. After reading the reviews I gave this Xtremepower suction vacuum a try. It works amazingly for the dust, however I doesn’t pickup the leaves and other stuff lying on the pool floor. I gave it 5 stars for the value of te product. It has a very reasonable price and does the job that my expensive robotics vacuum does not.
customer_reviews.author: Yeney P.

customer_reviews.title: Green pool to blue and crystal clear.
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy this as my pool guy told me specifically not to buy this kind/brand of pool vacuum cleaner. Our pool turned green from algae and our pool guy told us it’s time to drain the water out after failed attempts at shocking the pool. We live in an area that’s windy so dust always settles in our pool making the water cloudy. I was gonna go for a more expensive known brand but took a chance on this since it’s way more economical and had great reviews. This was a lifesaver for us, along with shock formula and chlorine tablets. From a green pool, we now enjoy a crystal clear pool. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: IluvBray

customer_reviews.title: Great product compared to "name" brand
customer_reviews.text: This is the third Xtremepower cleaner I have purchased. I have used them for several years. I started with the "name" brand but found the name brand too expensive to replace parts that wear like the round pad. Because I live in the SW, I use my pool almost year around, so these units get a LOT of use!! The do a great job in keeping my pool clean and the round pad lasts much longer than the name brand units. I use them so long the wear out from so much use (several years of constant use) and then I buy another one. I have used these cleaners for over 6 years.
customer_reviews.author: Billiam

customer_reviews.title: Still deciding
customer_reviews.text: Im still trying to decide if ithe product was worth the buy. Used it for the first time started off good suction did well, then has time went on it lost I'de say about half its suction. I did buy a leaf canister to connect to the hose to keep debris out the filter, not sure if that contributed to the loss of suction.
customer_reviews.author: Rena Liufau

customer_reviews.title: works for a few days and stopped working
customer_reviews.text: On the first few days, it works great. It's relying on the suction power from the pump and there's a door in the valve that creates a vibration that allows this vacuum to move around slowly. I could clearly see dust being sucked clean. I also worried about whether it is doing damage to my pump since the little door on the pipe keeps opening and closing, causing my filter's pressure meter to jump all over the place. After a few days, this thing stops vibrating and moving and that's when I decided to return it. I don't feel it's safe for my pump.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Applebaum

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It was a bit hard to follow the directions, and it took a lot of effort to connect a couple of things, but I managed. I finally looked up a youtube video that helped immensely when the directions just didn't make sense. This thing is very powerful! It goes up the pool walls, cleans the floor of the pool and leaves my pool looking great without all the effort of vacuuming it myself. It does an excellent job, better than the one that came with my pool. I have a 16'x52" above ground pool with a 2 hp motor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Check for worn parts before the year is up
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little wandering 'vacuum' for those days when you get lots of stuff in the pool (dirt, loose algae, etc). There are issues, but that has to do with the size and shape of our pool. The biggest issue is that I failed to look at all parts when I removed it from the pool right before the 'warranty' expires. The pieces are getting worn out, especially those small ball like objects on the bumper. That and the bottom center piece. Use it as much as possible in the first 11 months, then examine it really well.
customer_reviews.author: BlackLabsMatter

customer_reviews.title: 3 years and still running
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item back in 2016. I logged in to purchase this item again since the it stopped moving. I read a review from someone stating that they had to add a washer to the screw to keep the little "flap" from getting stuck. I tried it and this thing is back up and running again. I was prepared to buy one of these every year since I have a tiny pool. Nothing fancy. But 3 years out of this cleaner is pretty good in my books.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Pascual

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I own a 15ft x 48in intex pool and needed something better than the cheap pump that comes with it, so I upgraded that. Then I got this, which works great. I cant just let the vacuum go by itself because my pool isnt level and it wants to go to one end all the time plus I have a drain plug as well that it gets caught on. Other than those to things, it works great. I had to make an adapter for it to hook up to the inlet port but that was easy. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Jones

customer_reviews.title: Decent buy. Be prepared to babysit it!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 24' round pool and this vacuum hose is not long enough. I take that back it is long enough but it binds on itself waaaaay to much. I followed the instructions to a "T" and I still have to move it around so it will reach the far side away from the skimmer. So far the little flap people complain about wearing down has not broken hopefully I'll get a few more Sean's use out of it! Also I have a ladder/steps that lead down into the pool from a deck and it constantly gets hung up on it.
customer_reviews.author: Daddys Profile

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect much given the price point, but after the (very easy) assembly it very quickly became obvious that it actually works. It does move randomly, so don't expect magic, but if you give it time it will get the job done. Just make sure you clean out the basket in the pump and backwash regularly if your pool is really dirty.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver Gampe

customer_reviews.title: it's not the best, but for the money it works
customer_reviews.text: Overall, it's fine. Easy to assemble. Cleans the pool pretty well. But made from cheap materials. We have bought 3 of these over the past 4 or so years (but we do run it all years round). Don't expect a top of the line machine, but it does the job. We had plenty of problems with more expensive vacuums out there as well (we get an excessive amount of debris in our pool from neighboring eucalyptus trees). So having to buy an $80 vacuum every 18 months makes more sense to me than a 300-400 investment every couple of years. As far as performance, it works the way it is supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: JazzmanB

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as a KK - totally worth it
customer_reviews.text: As a 20+ year pool owner, we’ve had many pool cleaners. We’ve had the Kreepy Krauly, we’ve had Dolphin, we’ve had 3 or 4 robot vacuums some close to a thousand dollars. For the price that I spent on this, even if I had to replace it annually it is worth it! We’ve had it going for 5 weeks now. We had a quote of $170 to replace a gear/part on our Robovac and so I took a chance on this. Loving it so far and easy peasy setup per hubby and we didn’t have to weight the flapper or make any modifications. For under $100, EXCELLENT purchase from the AZ desert.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stops working after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: When we first got this it worked amazing & now it’s more hassle then it’s worth. We should have spent the money and gotten a slightly better vacuum. My husband is outside at least 30-45min a day Messing with it trying to get it to work. He makes sure the pump is backwashed the pump filters and cartridges are clean and our leaf basket is clean & checks the vacuum hoses and the head of the vacuum are all clear & it still won’t move more than 3ft and stops. Even our pool guy has no idea why it does this. Don’t buy waste of money and time.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Laursen

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Money $$
customer_reviews.text: It is so easy to use. Follow the directions When placing the weighted collars and let the sweeper do the work for you. I let this run for a couple hours then remove. Sometimes it gets stuck behind ladder, if so, try added or removing sections of the hose. Mine will run 95% of the time with out getting stuck. I did add an inline skimmer basket 2 hose connections before the suction main connection to filter to catch the leaves. GOOD INVESTMENT 52” x 18’ above ground pool
customer_reviews.author: Woman be shopping

customer_reviews.title: Great! At first
customer_reviews.text: Purchased June and broken by first week in August. It worked wonderfully, stopped alternating between two power sources. Called customer service, asked us to check if something was stuck. Took it apart, put it back together and it still isn’t functioning. The pool port is sucking, just not the vacuum. Disappointed in our purchase. I expected it to last a couple years. Also, emailed and xtremepower US said they can't help because they aren't the manufacture, when the listing shows them as one. Sad Amazon allows this to go on.
customer_reviews.author: lambzann

customer_reviews.title: Pictures don’t lie
customer_reviews.text: Pictures don’t lie. Hooked this sucker up today. Did not really see how dirty my pool was until it was functioning. This is replacing my old Dolphin and I like this better. My pool needs a vac mate but otherwise it’s wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Sierra Holloway

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre for me
customer_reviews.text: Slow but does an adequate job for above ground pool. Not as good as my previous one by a long shot but previous one broke and was no longer available. It’s so so, might work better for others and I might be doing something wrong bc it is a little complicated knowing what levels to put the floaters and such. The picture above is just clean and treated, used the device but had to go back and clean more manually. Need to leave it going over night bc it’s so slow.
customer_reviews.author: Brian B.

customer_reviews.title: works better than the $300 ones
customer_reviews.text: I had read all the reviews for this and one review was extremely helpful and was the reason I purchased this. My husband spent a couple of minutes putting it together and within a minute that sucker was sucking across our pool in no time; it's doing about 12ft per minute and for once I have a clear water pool. If you're on the fence about which one to purchase get this one. It works as well as the more expensive ones and is easy to assemble. Only problem we had was our pool is a big one and we had to add an extra 20feet of hose but no problem it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Maro

customer_reviews.title: Great product it has been for me
customer_reviews.text: Have had this gem for over a year now and it has been chugging along strong so far sucking up dirt, leaves and palm tree blossoms like a boss. Would recommend this to anyone with a 10k gallon pool since it works so well for me. There are obviously some trouble areas like having to occasionally remove the lodged palm tree fruit from the flapper but all in all it has worked well for me. I use the vacuum once a week in the morning for several hours while I do other chores around outside like mowing the lawn followed by balancing the pool chems and cleaning out the filters after it is finished vacuuming.
customer_reviews.author: etwang80

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed!! After years of replacing the brush style vacuum heads on those long clumsy poles and skimming bristles out of the pool when the brush head was no good anymore. This took 5 minutes to assemble, hardest part was figuring how many hoses I'd need from the skimmer basket to the opposite end of the pool. I started with 2 weights....which worked well, but I just added the 3rd weight and it works much better!! I should've gotten 1 of these years ago!!
customer_reviews.author: darkhate668

customer_reviews.title: Great price and works great so far!
customer_reviews.text: Simple set up and I am surprised how well it works. So far for the money it's a great investment. I found hooking it up to my skimmer directly and not using g their valve worked best. All I did was asjust the jandy valve to the desired suction. The real question will be durability and how long it works
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: The vacuum works great.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second of this style vacuum. I live in Florida so the unit runs year round and is exposed to the hot Florida sun. The hose finally started breaking on my first unit after a couple years and the cost of replacing the hose sections was almost half the cost of the entire unit. I like the fact that the vacuum cleans the side of the pool as well as the bottom. Unfortunately it cannot climb over the step lip that is about halfway up the side of the pool. That is not a huge issue because most automatic vacuums only do the bottom period. I am very happy with the vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Kent C.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed for my pool
customer_reviews.text: This was the best $79 I have spent on my pool. I have used it approximately 4 times already. This takes care of all of the little stuff that sinks to the bottom, including worms and dirt. I have a screen enclosure over my pool, so leaves are not an issue. It only took 1 trial to get the hose length correct for my pool size and shape. It is super easy to assemble out of the box and as well as simple to get going in the pool whenever we need to use it. I would highly recommend this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Adams

customer_reviews.title: This unit works.
customer_reviews.text: I would have given it a 5 star but it didn't fit my input port on my above ground pool. I used the adapter that came with my manual sweep and it fit well enough for the unit to work. And, the assembly instructions were not very clear. I have had several high dollar automatic sweeps (Polaris) that were absolute crap. In fact, I threw the last one away after only using it for a couple months. This unit works and it works very well. Course, this is after my initial hook up and usage. If it will stand the test of time, it will be awesome.
customer_reviews.author: David Williams

customer_reviews.title: Best value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I brought this vacuum, I didn’t know how long it would last, I figured for the price, if it got me through the rest of the summer and the easy Fall and Winter months it was worth it. It’s still working going into this summer. It’s takes a little work to get it set but once you do it goes. Value for the money, when it comes to pool vacs, $80 a year is cheap and I might be able to change out the slider valve and get more time on it. If it last a year at this price, I’ll buy it every time.
customer_reviews.author: Sassquatch

customer_reviews.title: SUCKS, OR DOES NOT SUCK
customer_reviews.text: We bought this along with the leaf canister. Problems: 1. The mouth of the vacuum gets clogged when long or larger leaves get sucked into the vacuum, causing it to stop sucking altogether. 2. At nearly every pool corner, it stalls or stops. 3. It cannot climb steps, ever. 4. Also, since there is no brush, you still need to scrub walls to prevent algae growth. Basically, this needs a babysitter, and since I have a large pool, it makes it entirely impractical.
customer_reviews.author: Moi Bell

customer_reviews.title: Not What They Used to Be
customer_reviews.text: A few weeks ago, I received my second Xtremepowerus pool vacuum. I had bought one years ago that was the absolute best pool vacuum I had ever owned. I used it until it fell apart and it was definitely worth the money! When I needed a new one, I didn’t hesitate to buy the same vacuum. This one doesn’t work as well. I have tried all sorts of trouble shooting, but it continues to follow the same circular path in my pool. My old vacuum used to clean the entire pool. This one doesn’t. I’m really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Good price. Good vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I had a tiger shark vacuum that finally wasn't worth repairing. Since it was late in the season I decided to wait and buy another tiger shark next season. So for the little time left in the season I decided to use this one. Easy assembly, adjusted pump speed and main drain valve and it was up and running great. It clens the floor and walls great. So I may save myself money next year and not replace with the expensive tiger shark.
customer_reviews.author: David Gunsaullus

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have taken a before picture of how dirty this pool was. We bought a house and this pool came with it so it is our first time owning a pool. There was so much dirt on the bottom of this pool. This vacuum is doing an amazing job. My only problem is the skimmer basket keeps filling up to fast with how much this thing is picking up. Definitely worth the price and more.
customer_reviews.author: hailey craig

customer_reviews.title: Gets stuck too much. Poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: This was the cheap version and you get what you pay for. It was constantly stuck and some point every time I tried to let it run (since it is supposedly an “automated” pool vac). It will only vacuum the finest particles and not a single leaf, no matter how small. It just got easier to use the manual vacuum rather than constantly move this unit to get it moving again every 30 minutes or so. I won’t buy the cheap version again.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Sanford

customer_reviews.title: Get product for the cost!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this to replace a old sweeper that needed more in parts than this cost. Was a little unsure, but thought I would give it a try, I have to say I believe that it work better than my old sweeper did new and I spent $400.00 om it. I really works and has the same problem that others have said by the steps, but outside of that it really works great and cleaning power is outstanding. Hard to believe for the money, but will buy again in the event I have any problems.
customer_reviews.author: P. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is awesome! We constantly have leaves in our pool and this vacuum seems to get all of them out. At first the vacuum wasn't moving around the pool, but once we adjusted the suction and the skimmer, it worked perfectly. I haven't seen it go up the sides of the pool. Definitely the best $80 spent!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: 4 years later -- still running well
customer_reviews.text: I am writing this review in October 2020. I bought one of these in Sept 2016. I am still using it. I'm only recently looking for a new one because the flapper has started sticking and I need to give it a shake every morning to start clicking and working. As I'm reading reviews, it's possible I can do a little maintenance and get it to keep running. Even if I can't, I'll order another one. 4 years for $80? great value and it does a good job, too.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Andre

customer_reviews.title: Owned it for 2.5 years now still work great...
customer_reviews.text: The cleaner has been working none stop 2.5 years until 2 days ago when it became hard to get started. So I took it apart were the flapper is. It was a bit dirty and corroded from the chemicals in the pool. So I cleaned it up with a file and some sand paper after taking all the parts off, including the rubber parts and the screw for the baffle. Then washed it real good with strong water flow to the sides as well at the flapper area. Put it back together and it working great again... Great cleaner highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Seruni

customer_reviews.title: Only lasts 1 month
customer_reviews.text: Worked ok for flat bottom pools, but got stuck in corners and would rarely climp the sides regardless how the suction was adjusted,and that was for the 1st month. After that it slowed down a lot and would only stay in deep end. Also note I have 2hp pump,,that creates enough suction to completely coil the suction hose,, Right about at 2 months, it's barely moving of making its clicking noises,,there plenty flow and suction. My old name brand pool vacs lasted 2-3years ,,so clearly this is knockoff only meant to last a very short time. Find a better one.
customer_reviews.author: vito tamarazzo

customer_reviews.title: Gets stuck on stairs - returned
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum sucks well. Cleans well in general. I added weights to the hose as instructed. It fell off walls. It won’t clean stairs whatsoever. Furthermore, it gets stuck on the corners of stairs and won’t move until I get into the water and manually move it. If your pool has no stairs at all I suppose it would work well. Based on the description, I thought it just wouldn’t clean stairs well. Not only does it not clean stairs, but it won’t clean the rest of the pool when it gets stuck on the stairs. Kept it for less than a day before returning.
customer_reviews.author: Matt M.

customer_reviews.title: Does a fine job
customer_reviews.text: I bought this gambling that it might be ok, since is was so inexpensive relatively speaking. It has worked very well. It does get stuck, but no more than the $450 cleaner it replaced (which lasted about 2 years) or the $350 cleaner that one replaced. It was a bit odd to see it kinda click its way around the pool (it actually makes a little clicking noise). The one thing that is a bit frustrating is that fairly small things will stop it from working (think tip of a palm frond, a small stick, the dogs 1/2 tennis ball ...) but move it and it gets right back to work. Over all we are very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Best Vacuum for Gunnite Pool
customer_reviews.text: Biggest bang for the buck!!! Works as good as vacuums costing $100s more!!! This vacuum works as advertised, set-up and installation was easy, just follow directions. Purchased and added 2 lengths of hose to reach the far end. Roams around randomly, up and down walls and bottom and eventually cleans all areas. I recommend installing a leaf basket on the hose to prevent big debris from getting sucked into the piping and the pump skimmer basket. I wouldn't want something getting caught in the underground pipes.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Bohaczyk

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Vacuum at a Nice Price (and it cleans pool walls!)
customer_reviews.text: The package came without instructions and the items required some assembly, but YouTube videos helped a lot. I was skeptical of the product because of the price. Our previous pool vacuum was 4 times as expensive and was still made of plastic and only lasted a couple of years. I'm thankful the price doesn't reflect the quality for this powerhouse. The vacuum is solid and well built. It doesn't *feel* cheap. It does and excellent job of cleaning the bottom of the pool. It, amazingly, does just as good of a job on the sides of the pool. It does tend to get stuck on the stairs, but this is a minor inconvenience compared to the value and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Political Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Great buy if you have the pump to run it
customer_reviews.text: Wow hard to believe this is $90! It took about 2 minutes to assemble. Our pool is 32,000 gallons and has cleaning jets in the bottom. They do great with normal dirt but don’t really move clarifier or phosphate remover. I bought this due to pick up the lanthium/phosphate remover off the bottom of the pool. It works very very well. I will buy one again when it wears out. Our pool pump is 3ph variable speed and at 2500 rpm this thing moves very quickly
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: I’d give it zero stars if I could. Where to begin? Worked twice, then nothing. Cheaply made plastic hoses continually disconnect no matter what you try. The entire contraption is very poor quality and poorly constructed. It’s not heavy enough to sustain itself with my new Heywood filter - it worked twice, then it died. Even when it worked, it never once cleaned the pool bottom, only the sides. Do yourself a favor and save a lot of headaches - don’t bother. You get what you pay for and this thing is junk; thankfully I had time to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: What a great product
customer_reviews.text: I have had a pool for 35 years and have always bought the other more expensive suction cleaner. Saw this and thought I would give it a try at 25% of the cost of the other cleaner. I thought I could always return it and was expecting to do so. But wow what a great product, works just as good if not better for a fantastic price. I bought a second one for our Florida pool and it worked just as well. I bought the extended warranty so for a total of 80.00 give or take a few dollars I have a pool cleaner for 20.00 a year.
customer_reviews.author: DRB

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase, works well, fraction of the cost of others
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I bought. Had my 12 year old assemble and install it. First one lasted 2 1/2 years of reliable performance. Still works but eventually the flexible plastic got “funky” which after that long is to be expected when exposed to chemicals and whatever else is occasionally trying to grow in my pool. For the price this is one of the best purchases I’ve ever come across. Thanks a lot!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Romo

customer_reviews.title: Works! Affordable!
customer_reviews.text: 2nd purchase. I have an irregularly shaped 34 ft long 14 wide plaster pool in phoenix. 7 to 3 ft depth with a set of stairs. The vac never really gets a rest, I keep the pool open year round, and don't take this out often. It lasted a year. Doesn't like leaves on the bottom or palm trash much. A few issues here and there to keep it going, but it works. Its semi automatic. I do have to reposition the hose throughout the pump cycle. Compared to an $800 unit? I have no idea, I simply could not imagine spending that much! Roughly $100/ year seems reasonable to me!
customer_reviews.author: Posting Publicly

customer_reviews.title: it works some what
customer_reviews.text: if you don't want to spend much it's OK,it go's around the pools deep end mostly I have to drag it to the shallow end, I have a deep pool, don't know if that matters, but it vacuums up what's under the round flap but I noticed that the flap shovels the dirt on top of it then leaves some off to the side of where it just was, the deep end stays pretty clean the shallow end has left over dirt have to keep dragging it back there, I had a navigator pool cleaner before and it would clean the whole pool without having to drag it around, but it cost 3 or 4 times more
customer_reviews.author: TEXTER

customer_reviews.title: Better than the old one
customer_reviews.text: This one has the suction paddle instead of the diaphragm. I had one of this before and lasted 3.5 year in SFL. so it is used year around. When it finally broke, I went lower cost and bought the ones with diaphragm, it lasted 13 months and can't find the right diaphragm for the repaire. It is on sale now for $5 less what I paid for a month ago. I hope this will last again for 3.5 years.
customer_reviews.author: Mickeysoft

customer_reviews.title: Didnt work.
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was easy and it comes with a hose kit. This item does not work at all. I have a 14k gallon pool, 3 foot deep at the shallow end and 7 foot deep at the other. I look after the pool maintenance myself, it's always perfect. My usual automatic cleaning device is worn out, so I decided to try this one as it was on sale. No matter how much I adjusted the suction on the return it just pulsates every couple of seconds and would not move in any direction.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: NEED HELP
customer_reviews.text: Hi, the seal doesnt stay flat on pool bottom. I have adjusted weights in many ways. Even taken off dive restictor from back to help front go down.. still no luck. I am using this pump  is there something i can do to get a better seal or add something to the front to make it sit down correctly?
customer_reviews.author: David C.

customer_reviews.title: XtremepowerUS 75037
customer_reviews.text: Works great. The only con I have is that it only has a 30 ft. hose. I have a 20 x 40 ft pool, so hose can't cover the whole pool. However I have 2 skimmers, so I plug into one skimmer for the shallow end, and the other for the deep end. My pool uses a liner, and there are some wrinkles in the liner. The cleaner goes over them as if they aren't there. This device is a good buy at twice the price.
customer_reviews.author: James Shepard

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this vacuum.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second storm that forced a mud slide into my pool. The last time I vacuumed the bottom it took three weeks, doing a small area daily. I took a chance on this vacuum and I am thrilled with the results. I assembled it in ten minutes attached it to the skimmer and let it loose. Because it is so wide, I could see fantastic results immediately. I did use all the hose pieces, I have a kidney shaped house pool. I have my crystal clear pool back.
customer_reviews.author: G. Fretz

customer_reviews.title: Great priced for a Kreepy
customer_reviews.text: Purchase this XtremepowerUS 75037 Climb Wall Pool Cleaner last week. Usually, name-brand pool cleaners can cost hundreds. This one is priced right. It arrived quickly despite the Rona Pandemic. It was easy to put together. Parts are just as good as if it were name brand. My pool is extremely clean; it's sparkling. Let's face it, folks, the name brand Kreepy is overpriced plastic. If you looking for a Kreepy Krauly, get this one because it will not break the bank, and it will get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos/Claudia

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Pool Cleaner at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical at first because the price was so low, but I have been replacing parts on my very old Kreepy Krawly for 15 years. I didn't even realize this came with the hoses, so that made it basically pay for itself right there as I have had to replace hoses from time to time and they aren't cheap. Anyway, the cleaner went together very easily - well designed and it is doing a great job cleaning my pool. Could not be happier with this purchase! Try it. I do not think you will regret the purchase. And if it doesn't work for you, Amazon is great about returns.
customer_reviews.author: S Duke

customer_reviews.title: Cheap! Didn't last 4 full months! DON'T BUY
customer_reviews.text: Cost friendly and does a great job. I have had it for a couple of months now and it does it's thing every night. We will have to see about lifespan, but so far so good. So...4 month in, I am less impressed. The back roller brace broke and a hole has rubbed thrown one of the main pipes (not a hose segment, one of the 2 pipes on the body). It pulling up the dirt, but loses a lot of suction due to the hole. It will not last more than one season. DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: READ ALOT
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews on this before we bought & I will more than likely go back to those reviews again for some more tips if I need them but so far so good. Hubby very happy with it. Like a kid watching fish in an aquarium "Look, it sucked that slime right up" One question my hubby had before we bought...."I see a lot of in ground pools but does it work on above ground?".....YES..YES IT DOES!!!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A Klemm-Gruzd

customer_reviews.title: Appears to work well
customer_reviews.text: Used this vacuum for one season so far. It was very rainy causing a tree near the pool to drop a lot of leaves in. As a result I had a battle with algae most of the season. This vacuum picked up a good majority of the dead algae that accumulated in the bottom of the pool. I did not have any issues with the vacuum's suction due to picking up a leaf, however I generally skimmed the pool before putting it in. I did have to play with the weights a bit. The recommended position would cause the vacuum to hang up in a corner of my steps. Changing the weights position fixed that issue.
customer_reviews.author: Theo

customer_reviews.title: Very Not Bad
customer_reviews.text: The reviewer who left the detailed instructions is right on point: Maintain your pump and this vacuum rocks.That being said, DON'T put this vac into your dirty pool and expect it to perform cleaning miracles. Put this vac into your clean pool and expect it to stay that way. I suggest getting a leaf canister to put in-line, it will save you lots of time emptying your secondary pump basket. My only gripe is that the big round flap thingie comes loose once in awhile. No biggie, it's easy to re attach. I want to buy a vacuum hose spinner but the ones I've seen here have less than stellar reviews. I'm glad I bought this vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Killian

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 12 months
customer_reviews.text: At first I loved this product. Worked great for at least 10 months. I thought I had found a bargain. Now the Suction Vacuum simply doesn't move. We took the device apart and reassembled multiple times. Serviced the pump, filter, etc...It just no longer moves at all. Before you purchase this item, make sure you only expect it to work for 6-10 months.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Housh

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: I've owned more than one of these, as after 3 - 4 seasons they don't seem to work as well as when new. However, for the price you can't beat it. Will occasionally get hung up in a corner, but that doesn't happen often. Works best if you make sure the hose is straight and doesn't have any "twists" before starting. I love it, and will buy another one when this one craps out.
customer_reviews.author: Daddio

customer_reviews.title: Above ground pool
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so I got this for our above ground pool. It works great, but I had to buy a pool hose adapter for our Summer Wave pool. It's 24ft round 52in high and the hose goes all the way around it. I dont have a skimmer, but it does come with a skimmer attachment. So if you have a skimmer you shouldn't need an adapter for an above ground pool.
customer_reviews.author: Heather W.

customer_reviews.title: Simply put... it works
customer_reviews.text: Second one I've owned, first one lasted a couple of years. For the cost... it's wonderful. Yesterday I spend some time with a mask, trying to fine-tune it. Turns out that moving the weights around to get the angle just right, makes a big difference. The bottom of my pool is clean as a whistle. It does stop whenever a large leave get's stuck, but a simple flip and extraction does the job. I love it. it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Glass

customer_reviews.title: Is what it is
customer_reviews.text: I have bought a couple of these pool cleaners. I get a season or 2 out of these cleaners. The flapper wears out. But over all good product for price. Easy to assemble. Good suction for a season or 2. I give it a solid 9 outa 10. My pool is a kidney bean shape 9 ft deep on deep end 3 ft deep on shallow does a good job except for steps cleans walls too. I just touch up with leaf rake. Looks like I have a service maintaining pool.
customer_reviews.author: brendon

customer_reviews.title: Great product affordable too
customer_reviews.text: We were paying a lot of money for people to come clean our pool, like a lot oh, we had those little shark vacuums that are on the end of a pole and don't really suck up anything, we bought this when it was on sale thinking well if it doesn't work it didn't cost you know like a couple hundred bucks it was pretty cheap, it's a godsend. Whenever we get algae in the pool and we have to shock and flock the pool and it all goes to the bottom, this vacuum sucks it right up. Definitely worth the admission price
customer_reviews.author: Stephen C Slykerman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Purchase
customer_reviews.text: My sweet dogs think that running around my pool is their personal race track, they are regularly kicking up sand which of course goes right into my pool. In my experiences with any of the higher-priced gear/wheeled type mechanics, they get worn down, they just can handle the sand. I heard some good things about this Suction Vacuum and oh my gosh, my pool looks fantastic in hardly any time at all! I couldn't be any more pleased and for the price... Wow and Thank You is all I can say.
customer_reviews.author: Cris

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I understand that this may not work for everyone's pool but it works great in mine! It has gotten caught in the ladder a couple of times, but other than that, it's awesome...especially for the price. I was considering buying an $800 Heyward cleaner but thought I'd try this first. Very happy I did. I get a lot of pollen in my pool this time of year and vacuuming it only stirs it up. This thing does an excellent job. I do have to brush it off where it accumulates on the edge of the steps but that's no big deal.
customer_reviews.author: 50 something that appreciates quality!

customer_reviews.title: Works fine but get stuck easily
customer_reviews.text: I like the vacuum. I have an in ground pool that has slopes and stairs. The vacuum does an adequate job but often, almost every time, get stuck near the bottom of the stairs or in a corner. You can easily flip the hose to another direction to fix the problem but it is inconvenience to have to watch it all the time. Kinda defeats the purpose of automatic. it's the only reason I give 3 star. Assembly is very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Quoc P.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Originally bought this vacuum because we were on a budget and the reviews didn’t seem too bad. It was easy to put together and has great suction. Butttt it does not stop getting stuck in the stairs. My husband and I have to constantly go get it out of the stairs. If not there then it’s just doing the same route and misses so much pool area. This definitely is not worth it because now we have to invest in another vacuum since we threw away packaging and couldn’t return it. Wouldn’t suggest this vacuum if you can pay a bit more for another I would.
customer_reviews.author: Melisa Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Did I get a Used Unit?
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a similar unit by Barracuda which lasted three years. Box arrived with it obviously have been opened and then retaped. Assembled easily enough, put into the pool, made various flow adjustments and the unit would work for a few feet then stop, I'd pick it up, set it back in and it would go for another few feet and stop... Needless to say, the price was attractive but getting a defective unit that was apparently previously opened/used is not acceptable... Looking for supplier to make good on this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Won’t stay together
customer_reviews.text: As you can see the rubber skirt will not stay in its groove. Sometimes it’s floating or gets folded under it as it will not stay in place. Would be fine if wasn’t for that so about to just send it back and try some other one. I’ve put it back in the groove 10 times in one day and no matter what it will not stay and has become aggravating to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: lt1z350

customer_reviews.title: Great pool vaccum for the price.  Comes with everything you need
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pool vaccum as a backup for my pool robot which is out of action with a bad power supply. I wanted something inexpensive to use keep my pool clean while I wait for the replacement part to arrive. I have been using this for a week and it is doing an excellent job. I have it attached to a 1.5hp pool pump. Everything you need to use it is included and it seems well built. an For the money is a great deal and my pool bottom is spotless. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: GAH1068

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic invention!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this creature. We hooked it up and turned the pump on and it is cleaning the entire bottom of the pool. It does not stir up the dirt on the bottom of the pool and make the water murky. It just goes around in different patterns and right by the side and randomly it is cleaning the entire pool. I highly recommend this product and I can’t see why it would ever break because it has no moving parts our pool filter is just shooting water through it. it makes it jiggle and it makes it go around randomly.
customer_reviews.author: tj

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware 👎👎
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of junk! CheapPlastic (made in China) didn't come with all the hoses. Did have enough for our size pool, so no big deal. Didn't have any suction. Kept getting stuck on the return port on side of the pool. I guess it's 'you get what you pay for' kind of thing. Sent back the next day. My biggest problem is, Amazon credited back to Amazon Gift Card instead of putting it back in my bank account! Not happy at all with that!!!! Guess I'll go to my pool supply company here in town and get a quality cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: S.M

customer_reviews.title: Sent very used Advertised New
customer_reviews.text: Very apparent sent me a returned product and used more than once. And shipped too me? Ok really It wasn’t even totally cleaned too look new. I was so waiting excited for it - Good price Reduced half. Requested return. Will update how that goes. I rated one star Haven’t gotten too use. Will update if when they replace
customer_reviews.author: uncapabrew

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: This pool cleaner seemed to work well initially, but then it stopped working after 3 months. I watched the trouble shooting video and still no luck fixing it. I called the company because it’s under warranty (1yr) and was told they’d send me a part so I can try to fix it. It’s only 3 months old, I don’t understand why it can’t be replaced with a new one. I asked about returning it and was told I’d have to do that through amazon. Unfortunately Amazon return window closed after a month.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for a few months now. I live in Florida and have a large uncovered pool in a yard full of oak trees. This vacuum works very well depending on your needs. It is probably great for most pools especially if screened in. It picks up dirt, small leaves and small debris that is the biggest need in most pools. I run it 7 hours a day and it does a nice job. It does not do well with sticks, acorns, large leaves, or a big mass of debris (like after a storm). That said no vacuum of this type will handle those and I don’t expect them to. Overall I am very satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Badbullgator

customer_reviews.title: Could not expect any better... forget the expensive ones they do the same or worst...
customer_reviews.text: 1 month of use and couldn't expect any better for the price.... gets the job done in a very dirty 30' x 15' in 2 to 3 hours... if it breaks I'll buy the same...
customer_reviews.author: Ismaray

customer_reviews.title: Constantly got stuck
customer_reviews.text: We have a rectangular pool only 6 feet deep on one end and 2 1/2 fee on the other. It’s 22 x 14. This vacuum should have cleaned it in about 30 minutes. Instead it just cleaned for about 2 minutes and then just sat in one spot. THe suction was fine, it just wouldn’t move. Then when it was moving half of it was floating above the pool floor? We returned I for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: TheElliott’s

customer_reviews.title: We purchased a vacuum for our inground pool and didnt ...
customer_reviews.text: We purchased a vacuum for our inground pool and didnt want to spend alot of money since it doesnt matter if you spend a little or alot, they always break down the road. After using it for a month, i find it works well. Although it gets stuck in one spot sometimes, a little wiggle and it moves properly. I would say its definitely worth the money and worth the find for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Margiotta

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: I have been very happy with this product. Haven’t had to use the old pole vacuum since I got this dude. I have a small in ground pool with two returns. Run the vacuum directly off the skimmer. Took me a little time to figure out how to adjust my returns to get the best performance out of the vacuum but i think I got it. I throw it in once a wk and let in do its thing for a few hours. Works great
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This last unit is cheap
customer_reviews.text: This is our second unit. The first one last over 18 months, but this one is wearing out after just 7 months. The plastic seems thinner, the tabs that hold on the flapper cover have enlarged from vibration and cause the flapper to jam. Plastic covering the stair guard have already worn down to the point I have to secure with epoxy. The gasket around the house connector has fallen apart from vibration
customer_reviews.author: J. D Martyn

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work, and no support available
customer_reviews.text: Horrible! I tried numerous times to get it to work with no success. Watched YouTube how to videos and everything to try and get it to work. Then their support line is horrible. I called multiple times and got a voice recording stating their hours of operation, all while I was calling in those hours of operation! Time zone considered!!! I wanted to return and now I realize I'm 1 day late. I guess I'm stuck trying to sell it. The reviews and description made it look pretty sweet, but it wasn't for me!
customer_reviews.author: JCdoingitmyself

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and use
customer_reviews.text: Likes: price, effectiveness, ease of use Dislikes: cleans but not efficiently. This is a great little unit that is quite easy to set up and use. It cleans well but it tends to go over the same places over and over. Eventually, it will cleanse the pool but might need adjusting the line occasionally. to take kinks out.
customer_reviews.author: Bob the Job

customer_reviews.title: Works Well, Use Bungee to Eliminate stuck areas.
customer_reviews.text: OK, this actually works pretty good. For all of you having problems with it getting stuck as I did, use some ingenuity. I attached a bungee cord, so that the tubes do not get bunched up around my steps. Now it works excellently. Look at picture for ideas. I first started with a weight and tried a few places until I found the perfect spot.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I have bought robot pool cleaners that cost a lot of money but for the money this pool cleaner works just as good as the robots pool cleaners for a lot lot less. Easy to assemble, the instructions stink so go to youtube and watch the video. I was impressed it worked right out of the box without any adjustments. I think I will buy another one for a spare. You can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: F F

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the exact same one that was here from the previous owner. The old one, purchased 5 years ago I believe, was still working but was really showing wear and the hoses were cracking one by one so it made sense to purchase everything. It was quite easy for me to put together and install in the pool. My only problem is one of the hose pieces came broken without the female ring
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Have had for 19 months. Just starting to wear out. Cleans the pool great but gets stuck in a corner of my pool where the steps enter. Its my pool design that causes the problem. Climbs the walls without problem all the way to the top water line. Picks up most smaller leaves and pine needles. Larger leaves will cause the flapper to get stuck and stop action. Clean the leaves out first. By moving the hose weights around have been able to solve the stuck in the corner issue most of the time. Very pleased with getting 19 months and will reorder another one. Laster longer than the Kreepy Crawler we originally had at 5 times the price.
customer_reviews.author: Gale M Witt

customer_reviews.title: It's a great day - this pool cleaner made my day!
customer_reviews.text: fedex dropped it off a day early at my door, about 45 minutes ago, it wasn't in a heavy outer brown box just a nice branded one layer box, easy to open, easy to take out, no frustration, took me 5 minutes to put together, threw it in the pool, replaced a 5 year old barracuda that was driving me crazy because it just didn't work anymore, this pool cleaner worked instantly, I can't recommend it enough it is great!!
customer_reviews.author: bwolmarans

product_meta.title: XtremepowerUS 75037 Climb Wall Pool Cleaner Automatic Suction Vacuum-Generic, Blue
product_meta.description: Deluxe automatic pool cleaner vacuum with a set of hose included! This item is perfect for efficiently cleaning dirt, leaves, debris, bugs, pebbles and short twigs from your pool; allowing you to spend more time in your swimming pool instead of cleaning it. No wheels or gears means no jamming, breaking or otherwise interrupting the cleaning process. Thinking smarter, not harder, is the key to enjoying your backyard oasis worry-free this summer! Features: Design- Design High efficiency and low maintenance Durable Cleaner - More durable than those cleaners made of thinner PVC Simple Design - There are no wheels to jam, no gears to break Its smart design for easy maintenance Existing Filtration System - Attaches to your existing filtration system. Acts like moving drain, moving more water through the filtration system over a shorter period of time Requirement - Require at least a 3/4 hp swimming pool pump or 1600ghp to function properly Great Energy Saver - The devices navigate around the water by themselves. This means that your pool stays clean without the need to expend your time and effort dragging cleaning implements through the waters Able to Clean Gently and Thoroughly - Soft and thickened pleated seal(base plate) to clean your swimming pool gently and thoroughly, regardless of size, shape, or construction. Clean your pool from top to bottom automatically and effortlessly Effective - Clean a variety of different types of debris from the pool including leaves, twigs, algae and numerous other particles. This can prevent a build-up of debris which could cause damage to the integrity of your pool Recommend for swimming pool up to 16' x 32' No tools required / No electricity needed Package Content: Pool Cleaner Hoses Sets Regulator Valve Manual
feature_bullets: 10 hoses included for up to 30' pool. Ideal for cleaning bottom surface and wall; does not clean stairs
Require at least a 3/4 hp swimming pool pump or 1600 GHP to function properly.
No tools required and no electricity needed; Attaches to your existing filtration system
1 Year Warranty for Parts Replacement (For order purchased from Amazon.com Prime and Ihubdeal ONLY )
Cleaner should be moving about the pool at a rate of 8 to 12 feet per minute. Note : Refer to PDF attached below in Technical Specification for User manual

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars6,334 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
